data.prayer: Father, you desire to blot out the sins of the people of Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. You said, if they turn to you, you will dissolve their sins like mist.
data.verse: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Jaipur, Rajasthan, India
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, please give the people in the county of Jaipur access to a Bible in their own language.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 90 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Jesus, remind the disciples in the county of Jaipur to train each other to obey all that you commanded, and that you will be with them as they do it.
data.verse: and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age."

data.prayer: Father, we pray the believers are good spiritual stewards of their everyday relationships in Jaipur, Rajasthan, India.

Father, I pray against the principalities, against the powers, against the world’s rulers of darkness of this age, and against the spiritual forces of the wickedness in the heavenly places that are warring against the Chadwa people.
Lord of the Harvest, please send out workers into the the county of Jaipur, Rajasthan, India.
data.verse: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.prayer: Father, we cry out for a prayer movement in the county of Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. Please, stir the 72,888 believers here to pray for awakening.
Spirit, renew the call of John the Baptist in the county of Jaipur. Send out bold servants who will call all to repent.
data.verse: Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

location.name: Jaipur
location.people_groups_list: Pindara, Singiwali, Babar, Merat (Muslim traditions), Swetambara
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Pindara (68,000), Singiwali (400), Babar (500), Merat (Muslim traditions) (298,000), Swetambara (43,000)
